locale.name: en_US
locale.message: The following fields provide information about your submission's coverage. Coverage may include chronologcal periods (1920-1940, 17th century), and geographical locations ('Boston, MA', or 'Northern England'). If you wish, you may use the sample coverage field to include a relevant example from your own work.
Is this submission derived from another resource? If so, you may enter a URL or description of that resource.
Please describe your submission using a few key phrases. You may refine the subject with specific keywords in a latter part of the form.
If you wish, you may enter a brief statement about the access rights held in or over this submission.

The submission type is usually one of 'image', 'text', or other multimedia types including 'software' or 'interactive'. Please choose the one most relevant for your submission. Examples may be found at http://dublincore.org/documents/2001/04/12/usageguide/generic.shtml#type
This publication format is ready to be include in the public catalog.
The publication format you have chosen no longer exists for this monograph.
A publication format must be chosen.
A product availability code is required.
A product composition code must be chosen.
Check this box to use this Sales Rights entry as a catch-all for your format. Countries and regions need not be chosen in this case.
There is already a ROW sales type defined for this publication format.
You may assign an agent to represent you in this defined territory. It is not required.
You may leave the following section empty if you provide your own services to your customers.
You have been selected as a potential reviewer of the following submission. Below is an overview of the submission, as well as the timeline for this review. We hope that you are able to participate.
You may provide the editor with any reasons why you are declining this review in the field below.
This press has a policy for disclosure of potential competing interests from its reviewers. Please take a moment to review this policy.
I do not have any competing interests
I may have competing interests (Specify below)
This press has not set any reviewer guidelines.
Click on file names to download and review (on screen or by printing) the files associated with this submission.
Enter (or paste) your review of this submission into the form below.
In addition, you can upload files for the editor and/or author to consult, including revised versions of the original review file(s).
Are you sure you want to submit this review to the press?

Thank you for completing the review of the submission. Your review has been submitted successfully. We appreciate your contribution to the quality of the work that we publish; the editor may contact you again for more information if need be.
The editor asks that you either accept or decline the review before the Response Due Date and complete the review by the Review Due Date.

To ensure the integrity of the blind peer-review for submission to this press, every effort should be made to prevent the identities of the authors and reviewers from being known to each other. This involves the authors, editors, and reviewers (who upload documents as part of their review) checking to see if the following steps have been taken with regard to the text and the file properties:

  • The authors of the document have deleted their names from the text, with "Author" and year used in the references and footnotes, instead of the authors' name, article title, etc.
  • With Microsoft Office documents, author identification should also be removed from the properties for the file (see under File in Word), by clicking on the following, beginning with File on the main menu of the Microsoft application: File > Save As > Tools (or Options with a Mac) > Security > Remove personal information from file properties on save > Save.
  • With PDFs, the authors' names should also be removed from Document Properties found under File on Adobe Acrobat's main menu.
This series will appear on the main navigation
The category path must consist of only letters and numbers.
The category path already exists. Please enter a unique path.
Are you sure you wish to remove this category?
Are you sure you wish to delete this item? This action cannot be undone.
Please fill out the form completely.
Please select a valid option from the list.
You cannot add the same item twice.
If your title begins with a word like 'A', or 'The', place those words in the prefix field by themselves.
Submit an Monograph: Author registration is currently disabled.
Register as a Reviewer: Reviewer registration is currently disabled.
Include users with no roles in this press.
Not a user? Register with this site

For security reasons, this system emails a reset password to registered users, rather than recalling the current password.

Enter your email address below to reset your password. A confirmation will be sent to this email address.
There are no notes to display.
Are you sure you wish to delete this note?
Choose a predefined message to use, or fill out the form below.
Please ensure that you have filled out the message field and selected at least one recipient.
Fill in this form to register with this press.
Select a press to register with
There are no presses you may register with on this site.
Click here if you are already registered with this or another press on this site.
Click here if you are not already registered with this or another press on this site.
Enter your existing username and password to register with this press.
This press is currently not accepting user registrations.
The password you entered is not long enough.
Notified by email on publication of a monograph.
Able to submit items to the press.
Willing to conduct peer review of submissions to the press.
Willing to conduct peer review of submissions to the press.
Identify reviewing interests (substantive areas and research methods):
You must select at least one role
Registration and login are required to submit items online and to check the status of current submissions.

As part of the submission process, authors are required to check off their submission's compliance with all of the following items, and submissions may be returned to authors that do not adhere to these guidelines.

This press uses Open Monograph Press {$ompVersion}, which is open source press management and publishing software developed, supported, and freely distributed by the Public Knowledge Project under the GNU General Public License.

This site uses Open Monograph Press {$ompVersion}, which is open source press management and publishing software developed, supported, and freely distributed by the Public Knowledge Project under the GNU General Public License.

OMP Version {$version}

Thank you for downloading the Public Knowledge Project's Open Monograph Press. Before proceeding, please read the README file included with this software. For more information about the Public Knowledge Project and its software projects, please visit the PKP web site. If you have bug reports or technical support inquiries about Open Monograph Press, see the support forum or visit PKP's online bug reporting system. Although the support forum is the preferred method of contact, you can also email the team at pkp.contact@gmail.com.

Upgrade

If you are upgrading an existing installation of OMP 0.x, click here to proceed.

Recommended system requirements

  • PHP >= {$phpRequiredVersion} (including PHP 5.x); you are currently using PHP {$phpVersion}{$wrongPhpText}
  • MySQL >= 3.23.23 (including MySQL 4.x) or PostgreSQL >= 7.1 (including PostgreSQL 8.x)
  • Apache >= 1.3.2x or >= 2.0.4x or Microsoft IIS 6
  • Operating system: Any OS that supports the above software, including Linux, BSD, Solaris, Mac OS X, Windows

As PKP does not have the resources to test every possible combination of software versions and platforms, no guarantee of correct operation or support is implied.

Changes to these settings can be made after installation by editing the file config.inc.php in the base OMP directory, or using the site administration web interface.

Supported database systems

OMP has currently only been tested on MySQL and PostgreSQL, although other database management systems supported by ADOdb may work (in full or partially). Compatibility reports and/or code patches for alternative DBMSs can be sent to the OMP team.

Pre-Installation Steps

1. The following files and directories (and their contents) must be made writable:

  • config.inc.php is writable (optional): {$writable_config}
  • public/ is writable: {$writable_public}
  • cache/ is writable: {$writable_cache}
  • cache/t_cache/ is writable: {$writable_templates_cache}
  • cache/t_compile/ is writable: {$writable_templates_compile}
  • cache/_db is writable: {$writable_db_cache}

2. A directory to store uploaded files must be created and made writable (see "File Settings" below).

OMP Version {$version}

Thank you for downloading the Public Knowledge Project's Open Monograph Press. Before proceeding, please read the README and UPGRADE files included with this software. For more information about the Public Knowledge Project and its software projects, please visit the PKP web site. If you have bug reports or technical support inquiries about Open Monograph Press, see the support forum or visit PKP's online bug reporting system. Although the support forum is the preferred method of contact, you can also email the team at pkp.contact@gmail.com.

It is strongly recommended that you back up your database, files directory, and OMP installation directory before proceeding.

If you are running in PHP Safe Mode, please ensure that the max_execution_time directive in your php.ini configuration file is set to a high limit. If this or any other time limit (e.g. Apache's "Timeout" directive) is reached and the upgrade process is interrupted, manual intervention will be required.

For complete Unicode (UTF-8) support, select UTF-8 for all character set settings. Note that this support currently requires a MySQL >= 4.1.1 or PostgreSQL >= 7.1 database server. Please also note that full Unicode support requires PHP >= 4.3.0 compiled with support for the mbstring library (enabled by default in most recent PHP installations). You may experience problems using extended character sets if your server does not meet these requirements.

Your server currently supports mbstring: {$supportsMBString}
Your server currently allows file uploads: {$allowFileUploads}
Your server currently allows a maximum file upload size of: {$maxFileUploadSize}
The primary language to use for this system. Please consult the OMP documentation if you are interested in support for languages not listed here.

Select any additional languages to support in this system. These languages will be available for use by presses hosted on the site. Additional languages can also be installed at any time from the site administration interface.

Enter full pathname to an existing directory where uploaded files are to be kept. This directory should not be directly web-accessible. Please ensure that this directory exists and is writable prior to installation. Windows path names should use forward slashes, e.g. "C:/mypress/files".

OMP requires access to a SQL database to store its data. See the system requirements above for a list of supported databases. In the fields below, provide the settings to be used to connect to the database.

IMPORTANT!

The installer could not automatically overwrite the configuration file. Before attempting to use the system, please open config.inc.php in a suitable text editor and replace its contents with the contents of the text field below.

Installation of OMP has completed successfully.

To begin using the system, login with the username and password entered on the previous page.

If you wish to receive news and updates, please register at http://pkp.sfu.ca/omp/register. If you have questions or comments, please visit the support forum.

Upgrade of OMP to version {$version} has completed successfully.

Don't forget to set the "installed" setting in your config.inc.php configuration file back to On.

If you haven't already registered and wish to receive news and updates, please register at http://pkp.sfu.ca/omp/register. If you have questions or comments, please visit the support forum.
{$reviewerName} has been assigned to review submission {$monographId} for review round {$round}.
The round {$round} review by {$reviewerName} for submission {$monographId} has been cleared.
The due date for the round {$round} review of submission {$monographId} by {$reviewerName} has been set to {$dueDate}.
{$reviewerName} has declined the round {$round} review for submission {$monographId}.
{$reviewerName} has accepted the round {$round} review for submission {$monographId}.
An editor decision ({$decision}) for monograph {$monographId} was recorded by {$editorName}.
The submission {$monographId} has been restored to the queue.
{$editorName} has been assigned as editor to submission {$monographId}.
{$editorName} has expedited the editing process for monograph {$monographId}.
User added as a stage participant.
Enter your email address to receive immediate notifications of important new content added to the press.

This page shows important updates associated with this press such as new monographs or announcements. You may subscribe to these notifications through RSS feeds (by clicking on the images to the right), or through email.
A new monograph, "{$title}", has been submitted.
A reader has made a comment on "{$title}"
An editor must be assigned before you can initiate review.
A production editor must be assigned before you can initiate the editorial process.
A production editor must be assigned before you can initiate the production process.
You were requested to be an auditor on "{$file}"
You were requested to review copyedits for "{$file}"

Invalid monograph or no monograph requested!

You are trying to access a monograph that is not part of your series.
Access denied! You have not been assigned to this workflow stage.
Access denied! The user group you are currently acting under has not been assigned to this workflow stage. Please check your press settings.
You do not currently have sufficient priveleges to view the submission. Please edit your profile to ensure that you have been granted the appropriate roles under "Register As".
